Class RestXMLParser

Description
Description | Descendents | Vars (details) | Methods (details)

class RestXMLParser

helper class which parses XML representing a resource and stores it into the backend

  • abstract:

		buildCollection (line 1100)
	
 
	
	

build an array of collection data from XML, so that it may be fed to


syncDBCollection()  if a single xsi:nil element is found, then return an empty array,  signifying deletion of all elements  if no element is found, then return null, signifying no changes to  existing elements  otherwise, return an array of new element so that they may be synced  with the existing ones (i.e. add/remove accordingly)

	
    
				
  • access: protected
    • 
			


	
	

		string[]
		
			buildCollection
		
					(SimpleXMLElement $xml, string $path, string $key)
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				SimpleXMLElement
				$xml: the resource's XML representation root element			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$path: XPath to the elements that belong to the collection in  question			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$key: the key that will be used to put data in the array			
    • 
				

		
			
	




	
	

		el (line 864)
	
 
	
	

helper function which returns the 1st element of a certain name under  the XML tree. handy due to PHP syntax restrictions

		getID (line 1157)
	
 
	
	

helper function that parses the XML representation of a resource and  returns the root element's ID attribute, if any. Useful before calling  parse(), in order to validate existence of resource in the backend

	
    
				
  • access: public
    • 
			


	
	

		string
		
			getID
		
					(SimpleXMLElement $xml, [string $path = ""])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				SimpleXMLElement
				$xml: the XML representation of the resource			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$path: optional XPath for the main element			
    •

		syncDBCollection (line 945)
	
 
	
	

synchronize data collections such as middlwares, disciplines, etc., about an  entiity in the backend

	
    
				
  • access: protected
    • 
			


	
	

		void
		
			syncDBCollection
		
					(string $masterName, integer $masterID, string $slaveName, string $collectionName, string $collectionItemName,  &$data, [string $dataSlaveName = ""], string $data[])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				string
				$masterName: the name of the attribute that represents the  entity id			
    • 
					
  • 
				integer
				$masterID: the entity id			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$slaveName: the name of the attribute that represents the  collection item (slave) id			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$collectionName: the classname of the class that represents the  collection of items related to the entity			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$collectionItemName: the classname of the class that represents idividual  items in such a collection			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$data[]: array of actual collection data			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$dataSlaveName: the array key used to retrieve relevant data from  the array above. If empty, it is considered to be equal to @slaveName			
    • 
					
  • 
				
				&$data			
    •
